column1: Question: One year ago, the number of years in Jane's age was a perfect square, and one year from now, her age will be a perfect cube. How many years old is Jane?
3o-mini: Let Jane's age be x. According to the problem:
• One year ago, her age was a perfect square: x – 1 = n² (for some integer n)
• One year from now, her age will be a perfect cube: x + 1 = m³ (for some integer m)
We now look for small integer values of m such that m³ – 2 is a perfect square.
So, with n = 5 and m = 3 we find:
Thus, one year ago Jane was 25 (a perfect square), and one year from now she will be 27 (a perfect cube).
